label: 寝殿造
本: Edo Culture: Daily Life and Diversions in Urban Japan, 1600-1868 . University of Hawai'i Press . 1997
説明文: A style of architecture that reached perfection in the Heian period, when it was used mainly for the residences of the aristocracy and high-ranking Buddhist clerics. Along with the later shoin-zukuri, the shinden-zukuri is considered one of the two major Japanese styles of residential architecture.［平安、書院造］
